noun.description: A point on the sagittal suture of the skull in line with the parietal foramina.

origin: Late 19th century. From French obélion from Hellenistic Greek ὀβελιαῖος (given in Broca's paper as ὀβελαῖος) sagittal (from ancient Greek ὀβελός + -ιαῖος, suffix forming adjectives) + French -ion.
